alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 1:19AM MST until March 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Yavapai County near Prescott. * WHEN...Until 700 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and streams is occurring, with further rises in the water levels expected. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 AM MST, the stream guage at Granite Creek near Prescott reported 11.0 feet. Additional rises are expected as rainfall continues over the area. Flooding is already occurring along Granite Creek and Willow Creek. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Granite Creek, Willow Creek, Bannon Creek, Butte Creek, and Miller Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area this evening and overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott, Downtown Prescott and White Spar Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 308 and 315. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
